abstract: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has won the auction for Air Canada Technical Services in a deal valued at around C$900 million ($840 million), The Globe and Mail reported. In buying the controlling stake in the Air Canada maintenance division, the buyout shop aiming to create a leading Canadian-based aircraft maintenance firm that services airlines around the world
lead_paragraph: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has won the auction for Air Canada Technical Services in a deal valued at around C$900 million ($840 million), The Globe and Mail reported. In buying the controlling stake in the Air Canada maintenance division, the buyout shop aiming to create a leading Canadian-based aircraft maintenance firm that services airlines around the world

headline.main: K.K.R. Wins Bidding for Air Canada Division, Report Says
